title: Paulo Freire
summary: Paulo Reglus Neves Freire[lower-alpha 1] (19 September 1921 â€“ 2 May 1997) was a Brazilian educator and philosopher who was a leading advocate of critical pedagogy. His influential work Pedagogy of the Oppressed is generally considered one of the foundational texts of the critical pedagogy movement,[37][38][39] and was the third most cited book in the social sciences as of 2016 according to Google Scholar.[40]
